image.altText: A woman and a man sit at a table with documents and two photographs of soldiers.

props.synopsis: For years, 94-year-old Jack Hanna did not know where his father was buried. Now he's finally able to honour Private Richard Norman Hanna at his place of rest thanks to volunteers digging into history to give soldiers overdue recognition.

title.children: 'Doing it for the families': Overdue honour for WWI diggers lost in unmarked graves

image.altText: An SA Police car drives on a city street.

props.synopsis: Emergency services were called to a Willunga South property on Saturday morning but the man could not be revived.

title.children: 70yo man dies at vineyard in workplace incident in Adelaide's south

image.altText: A man sits on a stage with a headphone mic on

props.synopsis: South Australia's former Liberal leader David Speirs says a federal takeover of the state's branch should be 'seriously considered' but current leader Vincent Tarzia disagrees.

title.children: Former SA Liberal leader suggests federal takeover of state division

image.altText: a group of four women make cheers at a table covered in colourful drawings and textas

props.synopsis: The question of how to make friends in a regional town is often answered with joining a local sports club. But in South Australia's Riverland, a group is finding other ways to connect socially.

title.children: How do you make friends when you're new in town and don't like sport?

image.altText: Side profile of man with curly, dark hair and stubble. He wears a shirt and jacket and has a serious expression.

props.synopsis: South Australia's Attorney General Kyam Maher will address "gaps" in the state's law after a young mother's killer was sentenced to 11 years behind bars after he was found to be experiencing drug-induced hallucinations at the time of the offence.Â

title.children: SA attorney-general looks to remove self-intoxication as criminal defence

image.altText: Long green stalks of grass in plastic pots for collecting data. In the background is blue clear sky.

props.synopsis: Weeds cost Australia's crop farming industry around $3.3 billion dollars each year, but a home-grown invention that crushes herbicide-resistant weed seeds could make that a problem of the past.

title.children: Farmer invents machinery that smashes 'bejesus' out of weed seeds

image.altText: police gather on a sporting girl

props.synopsis: As authorities investigate a hammer-throwing incident which critically injured a 13-year-old boy at a suburban Adelaide athletics ground, police say the "tragic" situation appears to have been the result of an "incredibly unfortunate accident".

title.children: Teenage hammer-throwing victim 'fighting for his life' after 'tragic' accident at suburban sports ground

image.altText: An OzHarvest volunteer packs a package of biscuits into a woman's shopping bag

props.synopsis: As Australian households struggle with cost of living, charities are feeling the pressure â with food relief services in particular saying demand has never been greater.

title.children: 'Not enough anymore': Workers turn to food charity as Australians go without bare essentials

image.altText: A man in a white coat touching a Tomahawk cruise missile

props.synopsis: An American weapons company made illegal technology transfers to Australia at the same time some of its staff members took work laptops containing sensitive military secrets into Russia and Iran.

title.children: Australian links revealed in global defence company scandal involving China, Russia and Iran

image.altText: A man with white hair wearing a suit gesturing with both hands open to the side as if asking why

props.synopsis: Benjamin Netanyahu has built a proud reputation of being known as Mr Security, but now there's a new moniker that's being attached to him â Mr Death.

title.children: Many of his own citizens call him 'Mr Death'. But why is Netanyahu seemingly invincible?

image.altText: King Charles and Queen Camilla pose formally in dress wear in an ornate room with gold furnishing.

props.synopsis: King Charles has been dragged into a Senate drama over an obscure push to remove references to Queen Elizabeth from Australia's laws.Â

title.children: A royal clean-up sparks Senate fight over King Charles

image.altText: an aerial photo of some solar panels

props.synopsis: As Australia's electricity system gets cleaner, it is encountering a strange problem. More renewable energy is having to be wasted.Â

title.children: As Australia's power system gets greener, more renewable energy is being wasted. Here's why

image.altText: A graphic shows a woman with a blurred face looking at a mobile phone with a message above her.

props.synopsis: After a university student was bombarded with doctored, sexually explicit images of herself, the abusive comments started. So did a plan to bring down the perpetrators of what one expert describes as a problem so rife in South Korea it is "national disaster".

title.children: It started with a flood of 'ominous' texts. Then Ruma saw her face on fake porn images

image.altText: A copse of palm trees with leaves all swept to the right seemingly by strong wind.

props.synopsis: Super Typhoon Yagi makes landfall in Vietnam, uprooting thousands of trees, sweeping ships and boats out to sea and killing at least one person.

title.children: Super Typhoon Yagi kills four people and injures dozens of others in Vietnam after battering Philippines and China

image.altText: A close up image of a man wearing sunglasses.

props.synopsis: Two new reports paint a picture of an overburdened and under-resourced mental health system, with about 75 per cent of Australians feeling elevated levels of distress compared to the same time last year.

title.children: Linda felt let down after her husband died by suicide.  Two decades later, people are still falling through the cracks

image.altText: A bright electronic billboard advertising the turquoise waters of Fiji in a neon lit streetscape in China.

props.synopsis: As Palau's president tangled with China over tourist numbers, other Pacific Island nations were looking to its giant market of travellers to fill their resorts and hotels.

title.children: Pacific Island nations are promising 'authenticity and purity' to Chinese travellers. Will they come?

image.altText: Max Purcell and Jordan Thompson hold aloft the US Open men's doubles trophy

props.synopsis: Jordan Thompson and Max Purcell have crowned Australia's spirited US Open campaign with a redemption triumph in the men's doubles final.

title.children: Aussies Thompson and Purcell win US Open doubles crown

image.altText: A silhouette of a person wearing a helmet in the foreground; a destroyed building in the background.

props.synopsis: Russia's forces have claimed to seize a village in eastern Ukraine's Donetsk region days after Vladimir Putin named his "primary objective" in the conflict as capturing the entire Donbas area.

title.children: Russia seizes village in advance on Donetsk, defence ministry says

image.altText: Alexa Leary, photographed underwater, swimming freestyle at the Paralympic Games

props.synopsis: Australia has so far enjoyed a successful day 10 of the Paris Paralympics, winning two gold medals. Follow live.

title.children: Dolphins finish swimming program in style, Australia add 10 more medals to tally

image.altText: Curtis McGrath holds up his gold medal at the Paris Paralympics.

props.synopsis: After winning gold in the men's kayak single 200m KL2 event at the Paris Games, Curtis McGrath dedicates his victory to his wife Rachel and their young son Monty.

title.children: 'I did it for them': Emotional McGrath pays tribute to his family after winning fourth Paralympic gold

image.altText: Gold medallist, James Turner of Team Australia, poses for a photo with the national flag

props.synopsis: Australian Paralympic champion James Turner overcomes a sickness-riddled year to claim the gold medal that escaped him in Tokyo.

title.children: Turner ends illness-riddled year with second Paralympic gold medal

image.altText: Ben O'Connor riding his bike during stage 20 of La Vuelta 2024, looking exhausted

props.synopsis: Primoz RogliÄ poised to win Vuelta a EspaÃ±a with one stage remaining, as Australian Ben O'Connor holds onto second place by nine seconds.

title.children: O'Connor holding onto second at La Vuelta with RogliÄ on verge of victory

image.altText: Cameron Green at the crease, playing a pull shot against a fast bowler

props.synopsis: Australia made it a clean sweep in Scotland by winning their third T20 international in Edinburgh comfortably before heading south to face England.

title.children: Australia complete 3-0 sweep over Scotland in T20 series

image.altText: Composite of Rupert Murdoch, his two daughters and two sons

props.synopsis: Lachlan Murdoch turns 53 today, his first birthday since taking over the family's media empire from his father Rupert in November. And if he finds himself in a contemplative state of mind, how might he reflect upon the great balance sheet of life?

title.children: A dynasty divided: Lachlan Murdoch won the succession battle but at what cost?

image.altText: Hard Quiz host Tom Gleeson with his eyebrows raised and mouth open. The Hard Quiz logo is in the top right corner

props.synopsis: So you've aced a few trivia nights and think you can outdo me in Hard Quiz? Let's swap those bragging rights for a hefty dose of reality.

title.children: Feel like a trivia champion? Letâs test that ego. Itâs time to play, HARD!

image.altText: The unmanned Boeing Starliner capsule leaving the international space station

props.synopsis: After months of turmoil over its safety, Boeing's new astronaut capsule has departed the International Space Station, headed for Earth, without its crew.

title.children: Starliner capsule leaves International Space Station without astronauts

image.altText: A close up of the Queen smiling in a purple coat and matching hat.

props.synopsis: Two years ago an important chapter in royal history came to a full stop with the death of Queen Elizabeth II. Everything was about to change.

title.children: Two years after the Queen's death, everything has changed â and the future feels painfully fragile

image.altText: A man wearing a suit speaks to media, as seen in an AI video

props.synopsis: Showing how easy it is to make deepfakes of politicians using artificial intelligence, independent senator David Pocock creates AI videos of Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and Opposition Leader Peter Dutton.

title.children: David Pocock creates AI deepfakes of Albanese and Dutton as warning ahead of election

image.altText: Jim Chalmers wears a navy suit, looking solemnly off camera.

props.synopsis: With the national accounts this week showing the economy barely registering a pulse, more oxygen was expended on accusing the treasurer of being mean to the Reserve Bank than on what is happening in the economy.

title.children: Instead of studying the tectonic shifts of the economy, we're burning oxygen on the treasurer being 'mean' to the RBA

image.altText: A black and white photograph of Princess Diana

props.synopsis: The Japanese photographer's sublime black-and-white photographs cleverly capture subjects as diverse as polar bears and landscapes, to historical figures.

title.children: How Hiroshi Sugimoto tricks us into believing heâs photographed everyone from Princess Di to Napoleon

image.altText: Mother and child hug anonymous generic

props.synopsis:
Amber feared her daughter was being sexually abused by her ex. A family court judge said she was projecting her own experiences onto her daughter, and she lost custody.

Â 

Â

title.children: Amber's sister made a 'malicious' report to child safety about her parenting. It found its way into her family court case

image.altText: Donald Trump has a serious expression.

props.synopsis: A New York judge postpones Donald Trump's sentencing for his "hush money" crimes until after the upcoming US election.Â

title.children: Trump's sentencing in porn star 'hush money' case delayed until after election

image.altText: a composite image of paedophile Michael Guider who died in jail, he was charged in 2002 with samantha knight's manslaughter

props.synopsis: Nine-year-old Samantha Knight went missing in 1986, and despite extensive searches her body has never been found.

title.children: Paedophile who killed Bondi schoolgirl Samantha Knight dies

image.altText: William Gulson leaves parramatta court after being charged with grooming a child online

props.synopsis: English teacher William Gulson, 27, has been charged with grooming a child online.

title.children: Teacher from Knox Grammar allegedly asked 15yo if they 'found it hot' being the same age as his students

image.altText: A hippopotamus with its head out of the water

props.synopsis: Hippos have been a menace in Colombia since the early 1990s and have reproduced to create their largest population outside of Africa, after just four were smuggled in by drug lord Pablo Escobar.

title.children: Colombia orders hunting of Pablo Escobar's out-of-hand hippos, after decades of failed eradication efforts
